comment: Professor Woodruff provided outstanding support in this fast-paced Advanced Business Law course. Her clear explanations of complex legal concepts, real-world connections, encouragement of questions, and participation made learning easier. Timely feedback and her dedication to student success enhanced the overall experience.

Couldn't find proper class code BLAW4600. She's great. Not the most with it when it comes to PC culture, however she provides you with great information that goes beyond the course material. Tests and quizzes are HARD but if you've paid attention, you should be ok (I didn't, but that's on me and not her)

Honestly a really great teacher and really funny! Just show up and try to sit in the front so that way the lectures can feel more conversational! BEST BlAW teacher and the pop quizzes in class only help your overall grade!

There are abt 10 quizzes open online the whole semester and pop quizzes for extra credit in class. Just attend her lectures and take notes on the power point and you'll do fine. She's really funny too. One of the easier classes I've had.

She is a practicing lawyer, so her lectures were interesting and applied to the tests. If you don't go to class the exams will be impossible. Gives pop quizzes in class but no homework and one extra credit assignment. She talks so fast so take notes off the powerpoints at home.

Not sure what these other reviews are but for BLAW she was pretty great. If you took the time to learn the material you would do well as the tests and quizzes were directly from notes and open notes. She did a lot of lectures and it was a bit much sometimes but it's law material so what do you expect? She presented the information well.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This class is AWESOME! She makes the lectures engaging and interesting. Attendance not necessary, but she likes participation! Pop quizzes only benefit you and don't hurt you. 4 exams and 10 quizzes, all of which are online, and while they are lockdown browser + webcam, she allows notes on every single thing! She's great! Can't recommend enough!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Professor Woodruff is an amazing professor. Her lectures are very interactive so she will definitely call your name and ask a question to get you to interact and make sure you understand. She does pop quizzes that count towards your grade at the end of the semester. My favorite thing about her is that she brings real life scenarios
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Amazing lectures

comment: She is a great professor but if you dont go to class and only take notes from the slides, its harder. She says more things in class that are on tests in quizzes. Quizzes are due at the end of the semester and theres 3 tests, 1 being the final. Pop quizzes in class and quizzes and test are open note

I took her for the BLAW 2200 class. Her lectures are really interesting and she tries to use real life examples and really engages the class. She also offers many extra credit options which really help out. She really knows her stuff and I would definitely recommend this professor for the BLAW 2200 course.

Professor Woodruff is one of the nicest teachers at KSU. She is very helpful and knowledgeable about what she is teaching. My class only had 6 people so it was very personalized. She gives pop quizzes for bonus points with bumps your grade about a full letter. Definitely would recommend.
WORST BUSINESS PROFESSOR AT KSU!

Midterm & Final are incredibly challenging! Both exams were over 125 questions long. Very short time period reserved for exams. Many students were not finished with their finals when time expired. Few grades offered throughout the entire semester and the extra credit quizzes did little for most peoples grade.
I wouldnt recommend taking business law with her. Her exams are incredibly difficult & the material on the tests did not apply to what we learned in class.

Calculus and trigonometry were legit easier than this class! Would not waste my time or money with her! Never in my life have I taken such a long final exam with so many questions. Not impressed at all!

One of the worst professors & classes Ive taken at KSU. She Doesnt give enough time to finish exams & I cant tell if she wants her students to succeed or not. Wouldnt recommend taking her for Business Law!
Gotta be one of the toughest professors & classes Ive ever taken. Midterm & final are difficult with only a short period of time to complete. Ran out of time on final exam bc of so many questions....
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Midterm & final exam are nearly impossible! Good luck to any students taking it. Grading criteria is poor & extra credit assignment is tedious.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dont have to even come to class in order to pass, but I have no idea how anyone could pass her 125 question, 4 paragraph long questions without showing up to class... (she says a few people have passed her class without showing up... but they probably cheated!)
Don't have to show up to class... just have to pass two exams all semester! Incredibly hard and time consuming exams that even after studying for are difficult.
Wouldn't recommend taking this class unless you want to be miserable all semester!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Only two grades all semester! A midterm and final. Both tests are very difficult with long hypotheticals! 100 questions on midterm.... didn't even have time to finish it!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not impressed! Test heavy and tests are 100 questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: only 2 grades midterm and final come to class and pay attention and you will be fine.

There is no memorizing a myriad of vocab. just to turn around & regurgitate it on a test to "cover" material. Instead, Professor Woodruff uses engaging lectures that involve the entire class so you learn by being apart of amusing, anecdotal examples/discussion. -Two Test (Midterm/Final) -Allowed "Cheat" Sheet on BOTH -Extra Credit Opportunities
rating_tags: Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Woodruff is a practicing lawyer, and it clearly shows through the passion of her teaching and her knowledge of the material. No lie, it was a tough class but it was the first time I actually absorbed the material and can apply it to real life. 2 tests: one midterm, one final. Many extra credit options. Entered class scared, left inspired.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The final is purely theoreticals; meaning, the coursework barely, if at all, does not apply to any of the final questions. Only got through 30 out of 125 questions on the final, they take so long to read and there is no clear-cut answer. This class was about twice as hard as my Calculus II class. Going back to engineering, it's legit easier, wow

Mrs. Woodruff makes law interesting. She uses real examples and tries to involve everyone. The class is based off of 2 tests but there's extra credit and quiz points go towards test grades. She posts all of the power points online but not all of the info is in there. Attendance isn't required but she'll round the grade up (79 to 80 etc) if you go

An excellent professor who is also a practicing attorney! Brilliant lectures and fun hypotheticals. Only two mandatory grades; midterm and final. She allows you a sheet of notes for both, so passing is easy as long as you are competent. YOU MUST ATTEND CLASS! She does take roll and missing the information-heavy classes will make you fail.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Class only had 2 grades, midterm and final.  Both exams were difficult.  Having large quantities of lengthy hypotheticals which often have multiple correct answers requiring you to choose the "most correct."  Nearly the whole class failed the midterm.  She gave numerous extra credit quizzes and an extra credit paper worth an entire letter grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This is the hardest class I have ever had, and the worst teacher I have ever had. The final is 125 questions with two hours to take. Hard application questions. There are only 2 tests. I can't tell if she wants students to pass or fail. The only good thing is a big extra credit assignment, but it wouldn't be needed if tests weren't horrendous.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not the nicest person. tests are all application questions. doesn't give enough time. gave us 2 hours to complete a 130 application question final exam which was nearly impossible to complete considering a lot of the questions were asked paragraphs. lectures are long and boring. I do not recommend taking this course.

This professor's lectures are super interesting. The class is fun, however, she teaches the class as if we are law students. 2 grades, midterm and final. The final is 125 questions. I'd highly suggest signing up for a different class unless you're interested in being a lawyer...
2 Grades, Midterm and Final. All the tests are open note and book however it is all hypothetical. A couple extra credit opportunities  but not worth much. Id advise you go elsewhere.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Class is interesting and shes actually an attorney so she tells a lot of interesting cases. Take her if you can! A lot of material so expect to study

Bad professor. Very cocky. Her exams are meant for law students. She changes extra credits to mandatory assignments at the last minute when you're about to turn them in, so, for the people who didn't do them pretty much failed those assignments. The only thing that I liked about her class is the group activities.

she is very knowledgeable on the subject. Business law is a difficult subject. she explains the subject very well but you need to study.  the exams are 100 questions multiple-choice and t/f. question are scenario-based so you have to decipher the situation.  You have 4 online assignments. if you're smart do all her extra credit work.  I got an A.

100 question exams. 3 total for the whole semester. Exams are in multiple choice. Each question is a scenario that you must decipher or apply the law to. There is also true/false questions.  Cocky instructor that lectures you for complete sessions. No in-class assignments or study guides. She gives exams over wide range of chapters. (Ex. 20-39)
